018package com.scivicslab.actoriac;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
022
023import org.json.JSONObject;
024
025import com.scivicslab.actoriac.log.DistributedLogStore;
026import com.scivicslab.actoriac.log.LogLevel;
027import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActorRef;
028import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorRef;
029import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem;
030import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter;
031import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Transition;
032
033/**
034 * Level 3 wrapper that adds workflow capabilities to a NodeGroup POJO.
035 *
036 * <p>This class extends {@link Interpreter} to provide workflow execution
037 * capabilities while delegating node group operations to a wrapped {@link NodeGroup} instance.</p>
038 *
039 * <p>This follows the same three-level architecture as NodeInterpreter:</p>
040 * <ul>
041 * <li><strong>Level 1 (POJO):</strong> {@link NodeGroup} - pure POJO with inventory management</li>
042 * <li><strong>Level 2 (Actor):</strong> ActorRef&lt;NodeGroup&gt; - actor wrapper for concurrent execution</li>
043 * <li><strong>Level 3 (Workflow):</strong> NodeGroupInterpreter - workflow capabilities + IIActorRef wrapper</li>
044 * </ul>
045 *
046 * <p><strong>Design principle:</strong> NodeGroup remains a pure POJO, independent of ActorSystem.
047 * NodeGroupInterpreter wraps NodeGroup to add workflow capabilities without modifying the NodeGroup class.</p>
048 *
049 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
050 */
051public class NodeGroupInterpreter extends Interpreter {
052
053    /**
054     * The wrapped NodeGroup POJO that handles inventory and node creation.
055     */
056    private final NodeGroup nodeGroup;
057
058    /**
059     * The overlay directory path for YAML overlay feature.
060     * When set, workflows are loaded with overlay applied.
061     */
062    private String overlayDir;
063
064    /**
065     * Verbose output flag.
066     * When true, displays full YAML for each transition instead of truncated version.
067     */
068    private boolean verbose = false;
069
070    /**
071     * IaCStreamingAccumulator for displaying workflow steps with cowsay ASCII art.
072     * When set, workflow step transitions are displayed using this accumulator.
073     */
074    private IaCStreamingAccumulator accumulator = null;
075
076    /**
077     * Actor reference for the distributed log store.
078     * Used to send log messages asynchronously to avoid blocking workflow execution.
079     */
080    private ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> logStoreActor;
081
082    /**
083     * Direct reference to the log store for synchronous read operations.
084     * Reads don't need to go through the actor since they don't need serialization.
085     */
086    private DistributedLogStore logStore;
087
088    /**
089     * Dedicated executor service for DB writes.
090     * Should be a single-threaded pool to ensure serialized writes.
091     */
092    private ExecutorService dbExecutor;
093
094    /**
095     * Session ID for the current workflow execution.
096     */
097    private long sessionId = -1;
098
099    /**
100     * Constructs a NodeGroupInterpreter that wraps the specified NodeGroup.
101     *
102     * @param nodeGroup the {@link NodeGroup} instance to wrap
103     * @param system the actor system for workflow execution
104     */
105    public NodeGroupInterpreter(NodeGroup nodeGroup, IIActorSystem system) {
106        super();
107        this.nodeGroup = nodeGroup;
108        this.system = system;
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Creates Node objects for all hosts in the specified group.
113     *
114     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link NodeGroup#createNodesForGroup(String)} method.</p>
115     *
116     * @param groupName the name of the group from the inventory file
117     * @return the list of created Node objects
118     */
119    public List<Node> createNodesForGroup(String groupName) {
120        return nodeGroup.createNodesForGroup(groupName);
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Creates a single Node for localhost execution.
125     *
126     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link NodeGroup#createLocalNode()} method.</p>
127     *
128     * @return a list containing a single localhost Node
129     */
130    public List<Node> createLocalNode() {
131        return nodeGroup.createLocalNode();
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Gets the inventory object.
136     *
137     * @return the loaded inventory, or null if not loaded
138     */
139    public InventoryParser.Inventory getInventory() {
140        return nodeGroup.getInventory();
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Gets the wrapped NodeGroup instance.
145     *
146     * <p>This allows direct access to the underlying POJO when needed.</p>
147     *
148     * @return the wrapped NodeGroup
149     */
150    public NodeGroup getNodeGroup() {
151        return nodeGroup;
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * Sets the overlay directory for YAML overlay feature.
156     *
157     * <p>When an overlay directory is set, workflows will be loaded with
158     * overlay applied, allowing environment-specific configuration.</p>
159     *
160     * @param overlayDir the path to the overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml
161     */
162    public void setOverlayDir(String overlayDir) {
163        this.overlayDir = overlayDir;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Gets the overlay directory path.
168     *
169     * @return the overlay directory path, or null if not set
170     */
171    public String getOverlayDir() {
172        return overlayDir;
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Sets verbose mode for detailed output.
177     *
178     * <p>When enabled, displays full YAML for each transition in cowsay output
179     * instead of the truncated version.</p>
180     *
181     * @param verbose true to enable verbose output
182     */
183    public void setVerbose(boolean verbose) {
184        this.verbose = verbose;
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Checks if verbose mode is enabled.
189     *
190     * @return true if verbose mode is enabled
191     */
192    public boolean isVerbose() {
193        return verbose;
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Sets the IaCStreamingAccumulator for displaying workflow steps.
198     *
199     * <p>When set, workflow step transitions are displayed using cowsay ASCII art
200     * via this accumulator. The accumulator's cowfile setting determines which
201     * character is used.</p>
202     *
203     * @param accumulator the accumulator to use for cowsay display
204     */
205    public void setAccumulator(IaCStreamingAccumulator accumulator) {
206        this.accumulator = accumulator;
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * Gets the IaCStreamingAccumulator for displaying workflow steps.
211     *
212     * @return the cowsay accumulator, or null if not set
213     */
214    public IaCStreamingAccumulator getAccumulator() {
215        return accumulator;
216    }
217
218    /**
219     * Sets the distributed log store for structured logging.
220     *
221     * <p>Database writes are performed asynchronously via the logStore actor
222     * using the dedicated dbExecutor to avoid blocking workflow execution.
223     * Direct reads can use the logStore reference directly.</p>
224     *
225     * @param logStore the log store instance (for direct reads)
226     * @param logStoreActor the actor reference for the log store (for async writes)
227     * @param dbExecutor the dedicated executor service for DB writes
228     * @param sessionId the session ID for this execution
229     */
230    public void setLogStore(DistributedLogStore logStore,
231                            ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> logStoreActor,
232                            ExecutorService dbExecutor, long sessionId) {
233        this.logStore = logStore;
234        this.logStoreActor = logStoreActor;
235        this.dbExecutor = dbExecutor;
236        this.sessionId = sessionId;
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * Gets the log store for direct read operations.
241     *
242     * @return the log store, or null if not set
243     */
244    public DistributedLogStore getLogStore() {
245        return logStore;
246    }
247
248    /**
249     * Gets the log store actor for async write operations.
250     *
251     * @return the log store actor, or null if not set
252     */
253    public ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> getLogStoreActor() {
254        return logStoreActor;
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Gets the DB executor service.
259     *
260     * @return the DB executor service, or null if not set
261     */
262    public ExecutorService getDbExecutor() {
263        return dbExecutor;
264    }
265
266    /**
267     * Gets the session ID.
268     *
269     * @return the session ID, or -1 if not set
270     */
271    public long getSessionId() {
272        return sessionId;
273    }
274
275    /**
276     * Hook called when entering a transition during workflow execution.
277     *
278     * <p>Displays the workflow name and transition definition using cowsay.
279     * In normal mode, shows first 10 lines. In verbose mode, shows the full YAML
280     * after the cowsay output.</p>
281     *
282     * @param transition the transition being entered
283     */
284    @Override
285    protected void onEnterTransition(Transition transition) {
286        // Get workflow name
287        String workflowName = (getCode() != null && getCode().getName() != null)
288                ? getCode().getName()
289                : "unknown-workflow";
290
291        // Get YAML-formatted output (first 10 lines for cowsay)
292        String yamlText = transition.toYamlString(10).trim();
293
294        // Render cowsay output
295        String cowsayOutput;
296        if (accumulator != null) {
297            cowsayOutput = accumulator.renderCowsay(workflowName, yamlText);
298        } else {
299            // Fallback to simple text if no accumulator
300            cowsayOutput = "[" + workflowName + "]\n" + yamlText;
301        }
302
303        // Send cowsay output to outputMultiplexer (loose coupling via ActorSystem)
304        IIActorRef<?> multiplexer = system.getIIActor("outputMultiplexer");
305        // Use actor name as source (consistent across all output)
306        String actorName = selfActorRef != null ? selfActorRef.getName() : "unknown";
307        if (multiplexer != null) {
308            JSONObject arg = new JSONObject();
309            arg.put("source", actorName);
310            arg.put("type", "cowsay");
311            arg.put("data", cowsayOutput);
312            multiplexer.callByActionName("add", arg.toString());
313        }
314
315        // In verbose mode, also send the full YAML
316        if (verbose) {
317            String fullYaml = transition.toYamlString(-1);
318            String verboseOutput = "--- Full transition YAML ---\n" + fullYaml + "\n----------------------------";
319            if (multiplexer != null) {
320                JSONObject arg = new JSONObject();
321                arg.put("source", actorName);
322                arg.put("type", "verbose");
323                arg.put("data", verboseOutput);
324                multiplexer.callByActionName("add", arg.toString());
325            }
326        }
327
328        // Log to distributed log store asynchronously
329        if (logStoreActor != null && sessionId >= 0) {
330            String label = transition.getLabel();
331            if (label == null && transition.getStates() != null && transition.getStates().size() >= 2) {
332                label = transition.getStates().get(0) + " -> " + transition.getStates().get(1);
333            }
334            final String finalLabel = label;
335            final String message = "Entering transition: " + yamlText.split("\n")[0];
336            // Fire-and-forget: don't wait for DB write to complete
337            logStoreActor.tell(
338                store -> store.log(sessionId, "nodeGroup", finalLabel, LogLevel.INFO, message),
339                dbExecutor);
340        }
341    }
342}
